data.title: Vorbis weird replay behavior
data.body:
If you load a Vorbis file in the `StreamPlayer` and press play on the editor, it works fine. But if you stop and play again it makes a weird sound (like the samples are out of order). It becomes worse each time you stop and play again.

It can also be reproduced by this code inside a `StreamPlayer` with a loaded Vorbis stream:

``` GDScript
extends StreamPlayer

func _ready():
    play()
    stop()
    play()
```

data.title: Event Player broken
data.body:
Looking at Event Player (event_player.cpp) it seems to be a Mod file player. So i tried to load a free .s3m, .xm and .mod file, but is impossible to load a file without an infinite loop error on console who locks the IDE.
Looped error on console: ![Image](http://i.imgur.com/23EI54O.png)
Project with the files and event player ready to load and lock the ide: 
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/wessjzl4y93o3jb/eventplayer.zip?dl=0

data.title: Polygon UV strange behaviour
data.body:
Hey I'm playing a bit with polygon uv and I'm trying to do something this:
![Image](http://i.imgur.com/ygNo6pO.png)
So I setup a texture on repeat mode and the uv like this
![Image](http://i.imgur.com/hugxwAn.png)
and on scene I shifted the two bot/top mid points and the result is this:
![Image](http://i.imgur.com/rAbfCfC.png)
That is a weird result, On my head I expect something like the first image, So this is a bug?

For what could be useful the fix if this is a bug:
Roads, Lasers and maybe plasma beams/water beams if the engine let to shift uv from code

data.title: Focus is not set when switching between Vertex, Fragment, Lighting shader tabs
data.body:
1.1Stable on Windows 7.  To reproduce:

1) Create a new material/shader
2) Start typing in the Vertex shader
3) Click the Fragment shader tab _without clicking in the editor window_, just click the tab
4) Start typing - the entered text goes in the Vertex shader editor pane

i.e. selecting one of the shader tabs does not set the focus to that tab's editor.

data.title: 2.0 Html5 Nightly Build (09/28/15) Issues
data.body:
While giving a test run with the HTML 5 Export, I've noticed a few things that were not working, this was from the 09/28/15 Nightly Build version:

-default_clear_color doesn't show the right background color,
-Input map from project settings doesn't receive or send any new input or accept any new custom import maps to the exported Html5 game, mostly stays on on the regular ui mapping keys.
And
-The mouse isn't captured or hidden.

data.title: Documentation Converter from XML to Open Project wiki markup format
data.body:
As posted [here](http://www.godotengine.org/topics/12130?r=12135#message-12135) help was needed with creating a XML converter to Open Project wiki markup format.

So, here is my PR.

The script works a little different than the other there, it takes more arguments. It **requires Python 3.x**. I added the option for the developer to choose a output directory, so the directory where the script is ran don't get cluttered with text files.

You can also specify the XML, by default the script will try to open the file `class_list.xml` that is assumed to be in the same directory. Here is the output of the command `--help`:

```
usage: makedocs.py [-h] [--input XMLFP] --output-dir OUTPUTDIR

Generates documentation from a XML file to different markup languages

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --input XMLFP         Input XML file, default: /home/jorge/godot/tools/docdump/class_list.xml
  --output-dir OUTPUTDIR
                        Output directory for generated files
```

I'm planning to add later a couple more of output formats, like markdown and dokuwiki (if they are required), and also _internationalization_ because `class_list.xml` will be subject of translations to several languages in the future.

data.title: Hide stderr when trying to detect mingw binaries on posix
data.body: This avoids confusion on unix as in #2486 where users think they don't have the correct build environment (even though they might not want to build Windows templates or binaries).

data.title: Game window placement centered setting makes window jump from top left to center on Windows
data.body:
My settings:Game Windows Placement -> Rect -> Centered

Game Window(start in godot engine): The game window first starts on top left then jumps to the center location. Is it possible to hide the window and show it after it is centered?
Exported Windows game: location is always(not centering) top left. 

Project selection(godot start): Is showing on top left. How can i set it to center?

Update: Windows 7 64-bit

data.body: It looks like the sensor mode for the orientation is not checking which rotation is currently running it is rotating to the default rotation on game start.

As said in the title. Trying to change any of the "filter" characteristics in the SamplePlayer inspector does not work, the parameters stay to their default value.

I'll work on it as I'm hacking at SamplePlayer anyway currently while documenting it.

```
                                      ^
tools/editor/editor_node.cpp:1397:38: warning: comparison between 'enum EditorFileDialog::Mode' and 'enum FileDialog::Mode' [-Wenum-compare]
    if (file->get_mode()==FileDialog::MODE_SAVE_FILE) {
                                      ^
```

data.title: Small renaming and bug fixing in SamplePlayer
data.body:
As discussed on IRC, the first commit renames _voice_count to _polyphony in SamplePlayer to be consistent with SamplePlayer2D.
This also makes it consistent with SpatialSamplePlayer and SpatialSound_Server_. On the other hand it will break code that rely on GDScript's set_voice_count().

The second commit fixes some copy-paste mistakes where linear/db volume functions had wrong argument hint or even wrong bound function.

data.title: Plugin path should be configurable in project settings
data.body:
plugin path should be configurable in project settings.
I should be able to add extra directories as plugin paths.
Some plugins are made as part of project development (like map editors,
various game data editore) which don't make sence in generic godot installation
and just clutter the interface.

data.title: Godot crashes when started indirectly in a terminal
data.body:
On Linux when Godot is started with a desktop launcher, if the option 'Run in terminal' is checked Godot crash and the terminal too.
If i use a bash file with the command `xfce4-terminal -H -x path_to_godot` I've just the message "freed code id 1".
The only way is first to open a terminal, and then to write the full path or the alias.

data.title: Fix BaseButtons remaining pressed when hiding while pressed down
data.body:
When a BaseButton is pressed down while being hidden (itself or one of its parents), it will remain pressed down. This easily leads to unexpected behavior when doing something like:

``` python
func _process( delta ):
    if is_pressed():
        get_parent().hide()
        print( "Pressed & hidden!" ) # will be called every frame after pressing
```

For more info see https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/2496#issuecomment-142167856 and [this forum post](http://www.godotengine.org/topics/12083?r=12112#message-12112).
This change "unpresses" the button when hidden. Closes #2496. Depends on pull request #2533.

data.title: Fix propagation of `NOTIFICATION_VISIBILITY_CHANGED`
data.body: For `CanvasItem`s, hiding a previously visible node's parent (direct or indirect) currently does not propagate a `NOTIFICATION_VISIBILITY_CHANGED` notification to the child. This change propagates the notification whenever the child's actual visibility changes as a result of it's parent's change in visibility.

data.title: DiagonalMatrix and ReflectionMatrix
data.body: It would be nice to have a function that creates a 3x3 (2x2) diagonal matrix from a 3D (2D) vector, and another (less popular) function that creates the [reflection matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transformation_matrix#Reflection_2), given the surface normal of the reflection surface.

data.title: No way to save an animation from AnimationPlayer
data.body:
I spent some time creating an animation in the player. Then I decided it'd be better to transfer it to another scene, so I save the animation... **except there's no button in the UI to do that!***

That's really disheartening, specially knowing that it was possible before.

You can create animations, duplicate, rename them and even load them from disk, but no way to save it. If there is, it's very hard to find, because I couldn't.

My workaround was to create a new one from the Inspector panel, save it, load it in the AnimationPlayer, copy the animation from the original and paste on the loaded one.

*_Added some dramatic effect, as it was actually a very simple animation._
